children.subject: Also eecs127 you can use Python instead of matlab....
Just curious, but can you list some CS courses that use MATLAB? The only I cant think of is EECS 127 (which is actually EE lol).

history.content: There is a self paced course (CS 9A) where you can self study MATLAB. As long as you read the textbook carefully and do not procrastinate too much on the assignments, it's a fairly easy course with some interesting projects. I just took it this last semester and I highly recommend the self pace courses in general for students who want to learn a new programming language but still want some minimal structure provided.

I took 61A instead of E7 but I've noticed a lot of these CS courses expect knowledge in Matlab. Is there a class here besides E7 where we learn it?
history.subject: What classes do we learn Matlab in?
